Articles.Content: What is the different between intakeAIR and intakeATM when flying? I noticed that I will flame out when my air reaches less than .01/motor but what information can/should I glean from intakeatm?
We like to keep the game-mechanics kinds of questions in the how-to section, so this thread has been moved there. Carry on.
I believe intakeATM is for collecting resources with KSP Interstellar, but intakeAIR is definitely stock and is used by air-breathing engines instead of oxidizer.
I believe that Master Tao is correct. I never even heard of IntakeATM, but IntakeAir is what jet engines use.

Thanks for the info. Sorry for the wrong section.

FLYNAVY
